availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Kackley (Germantown, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster)

body.p: Germantown, Kentucky, merchant and postmaster. Virginia native. Married to Margaret Kackley. Father of John C. Kackley, James J. Kackley, and Lucy B. Kackley. Dry goods merchant in Germantown in 1860. Postmaster in Germantown from 1865 to 1866. Police judge for Germantown in 1864. Secretary of the Union Agricultural Society for Mason and Bracken counties in 1864.

ab.bibl: Maysville Weekly Bulletin (Maysville, Ky.), May 6, 1864, p. 2; Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls. Records of the Post Office Department, RG 28. Washington, D.C.: National Archives, Bracken County, KY, Germantown, p. 20; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Germantown, p. 3; KYR-0001-007-0309.
